meanings.definition: Relating to or containing hydroxyl groups.
meanings.sent1: The hydroxylic compound reacted with the acid.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the hydroxylic properties of the molecule.
meanings.sent3: The hydroxylic solution was so sticky, it got stuck to the beaker!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as refreshing as a hydroxylic breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The hydroxylic nature of the substance made it easy to dissolve in water.

meanings.definition: Having the properties of a hydroxyl group.
meanings.sent1: The hydroxylic substance exhibited strong bonding characteristics.
meanings.sent2: The hydroxylic nature of the molecule made it reactive.
meanings.sent3: The hydroxylic material was so friendly, it bonded easily with other compounds.
meanings.sent4: His words had a hydroxylic effect on her, drawing her closer.
meanings.sent5: The hydroxylic properties of the solution made it ideal for the experiment.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being a compound containing a hydroxyl group.
meanings.sent1: The hydroxylic compound was used in the production of medicine.
meanings.sent2: The hydroxylic structure of the molecule was crucial for its function.
meanings.sent3: The hydroxylic substance was so popular, it was the talk of the lab!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a hydroxylic quality, spreading joy to all around.
meanings.sent5: The hydroxylic compound's presence could be felt throughout the room.
